content:
Sure, here's a character sheet for a male evil Oathbreaker at 11th level in D&D 5e:

Name: Azrael Blackwood

Race: Human

Class: Paladin (Oathbreaker)

Alignment: Lawful Evil

Background: Noble

Ability Scores:

* Strength: 16 (+3)
* Dexterity: 10 (+0)
* Constitution: 14 (+2)
* Intelligence: 8 (-1)
* Wisdom: 12 (+1)
* Charisma: 18 (+4)

Proficiencies:

* Armor: All armor, shields
* Weapons: Simple weapons, martial weapons
* Tools: None
* Saving Throws: Wisdom, Charisma
* Skills: Intimidation, Persuasion, Religion, Athletics

Equipment:

* Plate armor
* Shield
* Longsword
* Javelin (x5)
* Holy symbol (defaced)
* Explorer's pack
* 50 gp

Spells:

* Cantrips: Light, Thaumaturgy
* 1st Level (4 slots): Command, Hellish Rebuke, Inflict Wounds, Shield of Faith
* 2nd Level (3 slots): Darkness, Hold Person, Spiritual Weapon
* 3rd Level (2 slots): Animate Dead, Bestow Curse, Vampiric Touch

Features and Traits:

* Aura of Hate: Azrael and any of his undead allies within 10 feet of him gain a bonus to melee damage rolls equal to his Charisma modifier (4).
* Control Undead: Azrael can cast Command Undead to control undead creatures. He can control a number of undead equal to his Charisma modifier (4) at any one time.
* Dreadful Aspect: Azrael can use an action to frighten all creatures within 30 feet of him that can see him. The creatures must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 18) or be frightened for 1 minute.
* Oathbreaker Spells: Azrael can choose from a list of additional spells when he levels up, which are themed around death and undeath. He can also swap out one of his existing spells for an oathbreaker spell when he levels up.
* Aura of Despair: Any enemy within 10 feet of Azrael has disadvantage on saving throws against fear effects.
* Control Undead Improvement: Azrael can now control a number of undead equal to twice his Charisma modifier (8) at any one time.

Background:

Azrael was born into a noble family, but he never felt like he fit in. He was always more interested in the dark arts and the power that came with them. When he became a paladin, he quickly turned away from the teachings of his order and began to embrace his darker tendencies. He defaced his holy symbol and began to command undead creatures to do his bidding. Azrael is a cold, calculating individual who will stop at nothing to achieve his goals. He sees himself as a superior being, and those who stand in his way are mere obstacles to be removed.
